thread.title: Nationals closing in on Matt Wieters deal, reports say
thread.title_full: Nationals closing in on Matt Wieters deal, reports say

author: Alec Brzezinski (alec.Brzezinski@performgroup.com)
title: Nationals closing in on Matt Wieters deal, reports say
text:
February 21, 2017 10:26am EST February 21, 2017 10:26am EST News, Baseball, MLB, English, Washington Nationals, Matt Wieters Wieters has played in just 225 games since 2013. Orioles catcher Matt Wieters (Getty Images) 
Updated at 10:26 a.m. ET 
Updated at 10:26 a.m. ET 
The Nationals are nearing an agreement with former Orioles catcher Matt Wieters, according to FanRag Sports , which was first to report the news Tuesday. 
Wieters will get a two-year contract he can opt out of after this season, The New York Post reported. 
MORE: Miguel Montero appears to have cleared air with Cubs manager Joe Maddon 
Wieters has played in just 225 games combined during the last three seasons while dealing with a plethora of injuries. Still, at his best, Wieters provides some pop at the plate that could help Washington make up for the loss of Wilson Ramos. 
Despite the recent injuries, Wieters holds a formidable .256/.318/.421 career slash line with 117 home runs and 437 RBIs. He hit a combined 87 home runs from 2011-13. 
Washington also has Derek Norris and Jose Lobaton competing for a starting spot behind the plate. Watch This
